summary: Owners and operators of U.S. maritime facilities and vessels rely on systems that are connected to internal and external networks—including the internet. These facilities and vessels face heightened cybersecurity risks from certain nations and transnational criminal organizations. The Coast Guard provides guidance for and inspects facilities and vessels that are subject to cybersecurity-related requirements. But it can't readily access complete information on these inspection results—which...
title: Coast Guard: Additional Efforts Needed to Address Cybersecurity Risks to the Maritime Transportation System
